meanings.definition: The ability to see in dim light.
meanings.sent1: Cats have excellent scotopia, allowing them to hunt at night.
meanings.sent2: In the darkness of the forest, his scotopia helped him navigate the path.
meanings.sent3: The owl's scotopia made it the perfect nighttime detective, solving mysteries under the moon.
meanings.sent4: Her scotopia was like a superpower, revealing secrets hidden in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: With scotopia, the world at night becomes a magical realm of hidden wonders.

meanings.definition: A condition of the eye in which vision is better in dim light.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed him with scotopia, explaining why he could see better at dusk.
meanings.sent2: As she entered the dimly lit room, her scotopia kicked in, allowing her to see clearly.
meanings.sent3: His scotopia was so strong, he could read in the dark without any light.
meanings.sent4: The scotopia in his eyes was like having night vision goggles built in.
meanings.sent5: With scotopia, the night sky revealed its beauty in a way daylight never could.
